summary: This bill, the Monterey Bay National Heritage Area Study Act, directs the Secretary of the Interior to study the feasibility of designating specific areas in California, including Monterey, San Mateo, Santa Cruz, and San Luis Obispo counties, as a National Heritage Area. The study also considers other areas with similar heritage aspects. The Secretary is required to consult with various stakeholders, including the State of California, local organizations, and tribal governments. The study will be conducted in accordance with section 120103(a) of title 54, United States Code.
